Are you interested in a tour of the property? Need to book a tee time?  Planning a party?  We've got you covered! We look forward to assisting you and hope to see you at Green Pond Country Club for a visit very soon. Current hours of operation are ; Open 7 days a week from 6:30am - 11:59pm Our contact information is below based on department. _______________________________________ Rodger Zellner, President, COO, GM John Kulhamer, Golf Pro Nanci Oakley, Golf Outings Coordinator Shawna Shriver, Event Coordinator Brian Drake, Food & Beverage Manager Sarah Frey, Office Manager _______________________________________ Should you have questions or need information, please email us or submit the contact form below. [To request an event, please call (610) 253-2505 or submit our Online Event Request Form ] Contact Us Notice: JavaScript is required for this content. "CERTIFIED AUDUBON COOPERATIVE SANCTUARY" EAST COURSE

This charming private country club oasis, located within an exclusive gated community of only 875 homes in the heart of Palm Beach Gardens, Florida., offers members an array of the finest activities and events one could hope for. Exclusive year-round access to 36 holes of Championship Fazio Golf, two Comprehensive practice facilities with East and West driving ranges, putting greens and practice bunkers, a coveted tennis program on our 16 Har-Tru courts, heated 2,800 square-foot pool, two expansive state-of-the-art fitness center with certified personal trainers round out the list of some of the exciting amenities members enjoy at Eastpointe.

The history of Eastpointe Country Club and the fact that it has withstood the test of time makes it both charming and unique. The club and community was developed by Claire Anderson in the 1970âs and opened in 1974. Then in 1981, The Golf and Racquet Club at Eastpointe was developed by General Electric, adding a second premier club to the community. In November of 2015, these two private clubs within the Eastpointe Community, Eastpointe Country Club and The Golf and Racquet Country Club at Eastpointe merged to form what is now Eastpointe Country Club.

The benefits of membership at Eastpointe Country Club are endless. Our staff of dedicated, professional individuals are committed to providing exceptional golf, dining and social experiences in a friendly, inclusive environment that feels like home. We invite you to come and experience all that membership at Eastpointe has to offer. This private oasis can be your lifestyle of choice. As the General Manager of Eastpointe Country Club in Palm Beach Gardens Florida, this role oversees the operations of the country club and all amenities. Key responsibilities include managing all facets of club operations, such as golf dining, accounting, and member services, while ensuring seamless operation within the Eastpointe Community. The GM collaborates closely with the Board of Governors to develop and implement strategic initiatives, manage finances, and cultivate a strong sense of community among members and residents, thereby ensuring high satisfaction levels and a vibrant living environment. ABOUT EASTPOINTE COUNTRY CLUB Eastpointe Country Club is a premier, member owned club. It provides an exceptional blend of leisure, recreation, and social engagement in the heart of Palm Beach Gardens Florida. Ideally located just minutes from the beaches, a 20-minute drive to Palm Beach International Airport and surrounded by great shopping, nightlife and business. The community features two Audubon-Certified Fazio golf courses, dining, tennis, pickleball, and fitness, all of which provide a diverse year-round social calendar. The Pointe is a lifestyle amenity with a large aquatic center, state of the art fitness center and upscale casual dining and entertainment facility. The main clubhouse provides a range of dining options, from casual gatherings to fine dining, all showcasing scenic views of the 18th hole. Members enjoy a full calendar of events that feature live entertainment, themed parties, and social functions designed to bring the community together. Eastpointe Country Club requires all residents to have at minimum a Social Membership. EASTPOINTE COUNTRY CLUB BY THE NUMBERS: There are 975 homes within Eastpointe Country Club, and currently 75 new homes are currently being built (Reserve at Eastpointe). There are approximately 60,000 rounds played annually on the Club’s golf courses. The Club has an annual operating budget of approximately $18M. F&B operation revenues are approaching $3.1 annually. There are approximately 135 FTEs year-round and an additional 25 part-time seasonal employees. There are 9 Board Members, each serving three-year staggered terms. At present, the Club is considering various capital projects and is looking for the new GM to actively participate in updating the strategic/long-range plan. The Club uses JONAS for its accounting and POS systems, STS Cloud for Calendar and Banquet Management, and Fore Tees for tee times, and Golf Genius for tournament management. EASTPOINTE COUNTRY CLUB WEBSITE: www.eastpointe-cc.com GENERAL MANAGER POSITION OVERVIEW The Board desires a GM who operates in a proactive and highly engaging manner, collaborating closely with the Board of Governors and leading several active committees. The GM is viewed as the “face” of Eastpointe Country Club and, in partnership with key volunteers, serves as a primary visionary to ensure that ECC consistently provides exceptionally high levels of personalized service. This lead by example GM will step into a role that offers the chance to enhance and elevate both the overall membership and staff experience, aiming to be an employer of choice within a highly competitive hospitality community. The Board wants to collaborate with a GM who manages all operational matters and acts as an active thought partner on strategic and policy issues, while also being approachable, actively listening, and ensuring transparency regarding direction and operations throughout. A key factor in the new GM success is understanding the unique nature of member owned clubs, acquired through current or previous firsthand experience. An essential part of his or her success involves putting members first and recognizing that the foundation of staff support, mentorship, clear direction, walking the talk, and being present is provided in his or her authentic, sincere, and engaging style. The ability to effectively manage expectations at a high level of dynamic leadership and reasoning is critically important. Much of this can be achieved simply by being present, approachable, accessible, and diplomatic, as well as possessing the necessary talent to inspire confidence and be trusted by all stakeholders. It is critical to pay attention to the details of maintenance, SOPs, overall member experience, staff culture, and other key areas of success. Outstanding communication skills, particularly the proven ability to listen and respond respectfully and diplomatically, are essential for success at ECC while managing club and community operations. KEY ATTRIBUTES, CHARACTERISTICS, EXPERIENCES, AND STYLE OF THE SUCCESSFUL NEW LEADER: Possess a deep understanding of active club operations, with especially strong F & B skills, as well as solid financial acumen and appreciation for modern performance management systems and technology. Being financially astute and capable of effectively overseeing a large operation, including working to enhance financial reporting areas, dashboards, and transparency in KPIs and metrics, is essential. Possessing a proven track record of selecting and developing talent for senior leadership roles within club communities, support departmental leaders in their ongoing growth and that of their teams, promoting a culture of continuous improvement towards excellence in execution and delivery. Being a natural mentor is essential. Active participation and thought leadership with the Board, Committees, and others contribute to ECC success. Ultimately, the goal is to empower members to enjoy their time and volunteer contributions, focusing on policy-making and strategic partnership rather than operational decisions. Naturally outgoing, conversational, respectful, and diplomatic, yet able to say “no” when necessary, without alienating members or staff. It is essential to maintain respectful confidence and a strong connection with both the members and the team, as well as to adopt a personal approach of listening, considering, and reflecting before responding to input. Experience and skills in developing and executing strategic plans are essential, as is the ability to anticipate the ongoing evolution of the club and community. Staying actively engaged in the industry is also crucial, as is keeping up with trends in clubs, communities, and economic cycles. A demonstrated history of effective governance and leadership in collaboration with engaged Member Boards and Committees. Active involvement in CMAA or similar organizations where he/she has a strong network of peers and stay informed about industry trends and opportunities for ECC to remain relevant and proactive for its members and staff. CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS A minimum of 8-10 years of progressive leadership/management experience in a private member-owned country club community, preferably one with member boards and committee involvement AND preferably within a residential community setting. A strong history of success and a keen understanding of high-quality food and beverage operations, accounting, including revenue growth, training, innovation and creativity, and the cultivation of a robust service culture. A strong understanding of golf operations, maintenance standards, and effective engagement in programs and activities for member participation and growth. Experience in developing and implementing strategic plans and capital projects. EDUCATIONAL AND CERTIFICATION QUALIFICATIONS A bachelor’s degree is preferred, with a focus on Hospitality Management. Substantial private club/community or hospitality experience will be considered in lieu of the degree. Industry certifications for Country Clubs, such as CCM, CCE, CMC, or PGA, are encouraged but not mandatory. EMPLOYMENT ELIGIBILITY VERIFICATION In compliance with federal law, all hired employees must verify their identity and eligibility to work in the United States and complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire. SALARY AND BENEFITS The salary is open and commensurate with qualifications and experience. The club offers an excellent benefits package, including a 401(k) plan association membership, and cell phone allowance. INSTRUCTIONS ON HOW TO APPLY Please email your resume and cover letter to Club President Cynthia Mangiafico, CMangiafico@eastpointe-cc.com Please be sure your image is not on your resume or cover letter; it should be used on your LinkedIn Profile. You must apply for this role as soon as possible, but no later than Saturday, May 18, 2025. The new candidate should assume his/her role in early July.
